title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description:
1. Gather and document the detailed requirements for the SecureDataLineage system, including data sources (please specify types - both structured and unstructured, such as databases, logs, APIs, etc.), compliance regulations (please list specific ones, for example GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA, etc.), security standards (please mention relevant standards such as OWASP, NIST, ISO 27001, etc.), desired functionality, and non-functional requirements such as performance, scalability, availability, and potential security risks. Also, consider data privacy implications, data protection mechanisms, and incident response plans.
2. Identify potential integration points with existing systems, if any, and outline the necessary interfaces. Evaluate the impact on existing systems during implementation and post-implementation, taking into account potential changes in system performance, security, and user experience.
3. Define the data flow and transformations within the system, including data collection, processing, storage, and retrieval methods. Consider data provenance, lineage, and versioning throughout this process. Explore techniques for anonymization and pseudonymization to protect sensitive information.
4. Collaborate with the appropriate team members to ensure that the defined scope and requirements align with the overall project goals and objectives. This includes but is not limited to data engineers, security specialists, compliance officers, and user experience designers.
5. Once the requirements are defined and agreed upon, create a comprehensive documentation detailing the system architecture, data model, interfaces, and user interface design.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the SecureDataLineage system, including the data flow, components, and their interactions.

title: Implement Data Ingestion and Tracking
description: Develop the components responsible for ingesting data from various sources and tracking its lineage across systems.

title: Build Compliance and Security Monitoring
description: Implement the components that monitor data lineage for compliance with regulations and security standards, and generate alerts or reports as needed.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Create a user-friendly interface for administrators and stakeholders to view and manage data lineage information, compliance reports, and security alerts.

title: Implement Data Storage and Querying
description: Design and implement a secure and scalable data storage solution for storing and querying data lineage information.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Establish a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deploying the SecureDataLineage system.

title: Conduct Security Audits and Penetration Testing
description: Perform regular security audits and penetration testing to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities in the SecureDataLineage system.

title: Write Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for the SecureDataLineage system, including installation, configuration, and usage instructions.

title: Conduct User Acceptance Testing
description: Perform user acceptance testing with stakeholders and end-users to ensure the SecureDataLineage system meets their requirements and expectations.
